protocols.name: Traumatic Brain Injury Management
inclusion_criteria: Documented suspected or confirmed traumatic brain injury
Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) assessed after adequate cardiopulmonary resuscitation
exclusion_criteria: No documented suspected or confirmed head injury
GCS assessment performed prior to adequate cardiopulmonary resuscitation

requirements.description: Trigger criteria satisfied per protocol definition (textual gates).
trigger_conditions: Presence of suspected or confirmed traumatic brain injury with documented post-resuscitation GCS
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if trigger data missing; NOT_TRIGGERED if criteria not met.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if post-resuscitation GCS is not documented | INDETERMINATE if timing of GCS assessment relative to resuscitation is unclear

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Documented Glasgow Coma Scale score
Documentation confirming GCS assessed after adequate cardiopulmonary resuscitation
Location and timing of GCS assessment (e.g., Emergency Department)
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: GCS must reflect post-resuscitation neurologic status
GCS assessment must occur during initial Emergency Department evaluation or equivalent documented assessment
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

protocols.name: Rib Fracture Management
inclusion_criteria: Documented rib fracture(s) confirmed on imaging
exclusion_criteria: Ongoing shock or active resuscitation
Fractures limited to ribs 1, 2, 11, or 12
Sepsis
Severe traumatic brain injury
Documented anatomic or clinical contraindications where risk outweighs benefit

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Imaging confirming rib fracture location and rib numbers
Patient age
Respiratory rate
Incentive spirometry measurement
Pain assessment documentation
Nursing or respiratory therapy documentation of cough and secretion clearance
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if rib fracture numbering is unclear | INDETERMINATE if required physiologic or pain data are missing

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Trigger evaluation based on admission status
Timing references are evaluative only and must not be treated as prescriptive
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

protocols.name: Blunt Abdominal Trauma
inclusion_criteria: Suspected or confirmed blunt mechanism involving the abdomen
exclusion_criteria: No blunt mechanism involving the abdomen
Isolated penetrating abdominal trauma (handled under separate protocol)

requirements.description: Trigger criteria satisfied per protocol definition (textual gates).
trigger_conditions: Trigger Pathway A — Hemodynamic Instability:
Hemodynamic instability defined as at least two of the following:
– Systolic blood pressure < 90 mmHg on more than one documented reading
– Heart rate > 100 beats per minute
– Respiratory rate > 30 breaths per minute
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if trigger data missing; NOT_TRIGGERED if criteria not met.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if required vital sign data are missing or incomplete | INDETERMINATE if FAST result is undocumented when FAST is referenced | INDETERMINATE if imaging findings are referenced but imaging report is unavailable

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Blood pressure measurements (with repeat readings if < 90 mmHg)
Heart rate
Respiratory rate
Abdominal physical examination findings
FAST examination result (if performed)
Hemodynamic status at time of FAST or imaging
Abdominal CT imaging report (if obtained)
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Hemodynamic status assessed contemporaneously with abdominal evaluation
FAST timing relative to documented vital signs
Timing references are evaluative only and must not be treated as prescriptive
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

protocols.name: Blunt Chest Trauma
inclusion_criteria: Suspected or confirmed blunt mechanism involving the thorax
exclusion_criteria: No blunt mechanism involving the thorax
Isolated penetrating chest trauma (handled under separate protocol)

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Documentation of blunt thoracic mechanism
Chest imaging report (portable chest x-ray and/or CT chest)
Vital signs and hemodynamic status
FAST examination result when cardiac tamponade is referenced
EKG report when cardiac contusion or severe anterior chest trauma is referenced
Documentation of respiratory findings when chest wall injury is referenced
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if a referenced diagnostic finding lacks supporting documentation | INDETERMINATE if hemodynamic status at time of referenced evaluation is unclear

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Timing references are evaluative only
Chest imaging timing relative to admission must be documented when referenced
FAST or EKG timing must be documented when those findings are referenced
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

protocols.name: Screening of the Trauma Patient for Alcohol and/or Drug Use (SBIRT)
Mental Health Screening for the Trauma Patient
Management and Triage of Burned Patients
Spinal Clearance and Spinal Injury Management
Management and Stabilization of Pelvic Fractures
Management of the Orthopedic/Neurologic Splint and/or Brace
Monitoring Base Deficit
inclusion_criteria: Category I trauma patient
OR trauma patient explicitly designated by Trauma Surgeon for shock/resuscitation assessment
exclusion_criteria: Non-trauma admissions
Trauma patients who are not Category I and not designated by Trauma Surgeon

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Arterial or venous blood gas with base deficit value
Timing of blood gas draw relative to arrival
Documentation of Trauma Surgeon cancellation, if applicable
acceptable_evidence: Laboratory data (arterial or venous blood gas)
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if Category I status is present and no base deficit is obtained | AND no explicit Trauma Surgeon cancellation is documented. | NOT TRIGGERED if patient is not Category I | AND no Trauma Surgeon designation exists.

references: Laboratory data (arterial or venous blood gas)

protocols.name: Penetrating Chest Injury
inclusion_criteria: Patient with penetrating injury to the thorax,
defined as the region bounded by the clavicles superiorly
and the costal margins inferiorly
exclusion_criteria: Blunt chest trauma
Penetrating injuries isolated to the abdomen or neck without thoracic involvement

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Mechanism confirming penetrating thoracic injury
Presence or absence of cardiac arrest
Presence or absence of signs of life (blood pressure, cardiac electrical activity, respiratory effort)
Vital signs documenting hemodynamic status
Respiratory status documentation
FAST examination result (if performed)
Chest tube output volumes with timing (if placed)
Chest imaging results (portable AP chest x-ray and/or CT chest)
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if signs of life status is not documented | INDETERMINATE if chest tube output volumes or timing are unclear | INDETERMINATE if FAST result is not documented when indicated | NOT TRIGGERED if penetrating injury does not involve the thorax | NOT TRIGGERED if penetrating thoracic injury is documented without | hemodynamic instability, respiratory distress, tamponade, | massive hemothorax, or arrest criteria

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Determination of arrest and signs of life at presentation or during resuscitation
Immediate progression to left anterior thoracotomy in qualifying arrest scenarios
FAST exam performed contemporaneously when tamponade is suspected
Chest tube output thresholds assessed in real time
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

protocols.name: ROTEM Guideline
inclusion_criteria: Trauma patient with Massive Transfusion Protocol (MTP) activation, OR
Trauma patient receiving ED Blood Box or balanced blood resuscitation for ongoing hemorrhage
exclusion_criteria: No hemorrhagic resuscitation
No MTP activation and no ED Blood Box or balanced blood resuscitation

requirements.description: Trigger criteria satisfied per protocol definition (textual gates).
trigger_conditions: Applicability Gate met
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if trigger data missing; NOT_TRIGGERED if criteria not met.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if Applicability Gate is met but ROTEM is not ordered | INDETERMINATE if specimen handling requirements are not met | INDETERMINATE if ROTEM parameters or timing are not documented | NOT TRIGGERED only when Applicability Gate is not met

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Documentation of MTP activation or ED Blood Box use
ROTEM trauma panel ordered (EXTEM and FIBTEM)
ROTEM parameters with values and timing:
– EXTEM CT (coagulation time)
– EXTEM A10
– FIBTEM A10
– EXTEM ML (maximum lysis)
Specimen collection documentation (blue top tube, hand-delivered to lab)
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: ROTEM ordered during active hemorrhagic resuscitation
ROTEM may be ordered at any point during MTP
Results viewable in real time for up to 60 minutes on Epic Dashboard
Treatment decisions guided by ROTEM values:
– EXTEM CT > 80 sec → FFP
– EXTEM A10 < 40 mm → evaluate FIBTEM A10
– FIBTEM A10 < 10 mm → Cryoprecipitate
– FIBTEM A10 ≥ 10 mm → Platelets
– EXTEM ML ≥ 15% with “fish shape” in EXTEM/FIBTEM → TXA
Repeat ROTEM if bleeding persists after targeted intervention
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

protocols.name: Vascular Intervention Guideline
inclusion_criteria: Trauma patient with suspected or confirmed hemorrhage where vascular intervention for hemorrhage control is being considered
exclusion_criteria: No evidence of hemorrhage requiring vascular control
No angioembolizable lesion identified

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Blood pressure measurements (with confirmation of more than one reading)
Documentation of blood transfusion initiation
CT imaging demonstrating arterial extravasation or pseudoaneurysm
Determination of angioembolizable lesion
Trauma Surgeon or treating physician determination regarding need for intervention
acceptable_evidence: Imaging reports (CT angiography or contrast CT)
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if blood pressure readings are incomplete or not confirmed | INDETERMINATE if transfusion status is unclear | INDETERMINATE if imaging does not clearly demonstrate an angioembolizable lesion | NOT TRIGGERED if criteria for neither Category A nor Category B are met

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Category A — Vascular Emergency:
Angioembolization procedure must begin within 60 minutes of Trauma Vascular Emergency activation
Response time is tracked from request to arterial puncture
Category B — Vascular Intervention Consideration:
Timing of angioembolization is at the discretion of the surgeon if intervention is deemed necessary
Solid organ injuries should be evaluated in conjunction with the Management of Solid Organ Injuries guideline
acceptable_evidence: Imaging reports (CT angiography or contrast CT)
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

references: Imaging reports (CT angiography or contrast CT)

protocols.name: Suspected Hanging Guideline
inclusion_criteria: Patient presenting with suspected hanging, defined as intentional or unintentional asphyxiation by ligature or other constricting mechanism around the neck
exclusion_criteria: No history or concern for hanging mechanism
Non-asphyxiation neck injuries without ligature or constricting mechanism

requirements.description: Trigger criteria satisfied per protocol definition (textual gates).
trigger_conditions: Applicability Gate met
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if trigger data missing; NOT_TRIGGERED if criteria not met.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if hanging mechanism cannot be confirmed or excluded based on available documentation | NOT TRIGGERED only if Applicability Gate is not met

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: History consistent with hanging mechanism
Physical examination findings of neck, airway, and neurologic status
Vital signs and oxygenation status
Imaging results obtained based on examination and history
Documentation identifying presence or absence of traumatic injury
Documentation identifying presence or absence of anoxic brain injury
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Immediate airway and cervical spine assessment
Early neurologic evaluation for hypoxic or anoxic injury
Trauma activation initiated upon identification of hanging mechanism per activation criteria
Imaging obtained based on clinical findings (CT head, CT cervical spine, CTA neck as indicated)
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

protocols.name: Blood and Blood Product Transfusion
inclusion_criteria: Trauma patient undergoing active resuscitation for hemorrhage or suspected hemorrhagic shock
Includes all Category I trauma activations
Includes any trauma patient in whom blood product transfusion is initiated or anticipated
exclusion_criteria: Non-trauma admissions
Trauma patients without hemorrhage and without transfusion requirement

requirements.description: Trigger criteria satisfied per protocol definition (textual gates).
trigger_conditions: Applicability Gate met
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if trigger data missing; NOT_TRIGGERED if criteria not met.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if transfusion status (administered vs anticipated) is not documented | INDETERMINATE if Blood Bank involvement cannot be confirmed when transfusion is suspected | NOT TRIGGERED only if no hemorrhage is present and no transfusion is administered or anticipated

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Documentation of blood product administration (PRBCs, plasma, platelets, cryoprecipitate)
Vital signs supporting hemorrhage or suspected hemorrhagic shock
Documentation of anticipated transfusion need (if blood not yet administered)
Documentation of MTP activation and Blood Bank notification (if applicable)
Timing of transfusion initiation relative to arrival
Laboratory data when obtained (type and cross, fibrinogen, ionized calcium, ROTEM if ordered)
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Type and cross sent promptly when transfusion is anticipated
Emergency-release PRBCs available immediately for Category I activations
MTP initiated when massive transfusion is anticipated
Blood product availability benchmarks after Blood Bank receives sample:
– PRBCs (type and cross): ~45 minutes
– FFP: ~30 minutes
– Platelets: ~15 minutes
– Cryoprecipitate: ~20 minutes
During active transfusion:
– Blood products delivered per institutional algorithm
– TXA considered if bleeding onset < 3 hours
– Calcium supplementation recommended with ongoing transfusion
– PRBCs, plasma, and fluids warmed using approved devices
– Platelets and cryoprecipitate must not be warmed
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

protocols.name: Hypothermia – Prevention and Treatment
inclusion_criteria: All trauma patients, regardless of injury severity, mechanism, or age
exclusion_criteria: Non-trauma admissions

requirements.description: Trigger criteria satisfied per protocol definition (textual gates).
trigger_conditions: Applicability Gate met
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if trigger data missing; NOT_TRIGGERED if criteria not met.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if initial temperature is not documented | INDETERMINATE if timing of temperature measurement is unclear | INDETERMINATE if required rechecks or notifications are not documented | NOT TRIGGERED only if patient is not a trauma patient

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Initial temperature measurement with timestamp
Method of temperature measurement (core vs peripheral, if documented)
Serial temperature measurements
Documentation of warming measures applied
Documentation of Trauma Surgeon notification when thresholds are met
Documentation of repeat temperature at required intervals
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Initial temperature must be obtained within 30 minutes of arrival to the treatment room
Trauma room temperature maintained > 82°F
Operating room temperature warmed to 85°F for emergent or >1-hour trauma cases
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

protocols.name: Laboratory Studies Needed in Trauma Resuscitation
inclusion_criteria: Trauma patient presenting for initial trauma evaluation or resuscitation
Includes Category I trauma activations, Category II activations, and trauma consultations managed under ED trauma workflow
exclusion_criteria: Non-trauma admissions
Patients evaluated entirely outside the ED trauma workflow

requirements.description: Trigger criteria satisfied per protocol definition (textual gates).
trigger_conditions: Applicability Gate met
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if trigger data missing; NOT_TRIGGERED if criteria not met.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if trauma activation level is not documented | INDETERMINATE if required laboratory studies are not obtained and no exclusion or prior results are documented | INDETERMINATE if age, driver status, or mental status is unclear when screening applies | NOT TRIGGERED only if patient is not a trauma patient

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Trauma activation level (Category I vs Category II / consult)
Anticipated operative intervention status
Mechanism of injury (including MVC with suspected driver status)
Patient age
Mental status assessment
Documentation of prior laboratory results from referring facility (if applicable)
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.

protocols.name: Transfer of the Trauma Patient TO Deaconess Midtown
inclusion_criteria: Trauma patient initially evaluated at an outside facility
Patient sustained a traumatic injury and was transferred to Deaconess Midtown Hospital for definitive trauma care
references: Transfer forms and accompanying medical records

protocols.name: Transfer of the Trauma Patient FROM Deaconess Midtown
inclusion_criteria: Trauma patient initially evaluated and/or admitted at Deaconess Midtown Hospital
Patient sustained a traumatic injury and was transferred out to an equal or higher level trauma system

protocols.name: Management and Triage of the Obstetrical Trauma Patient
inclusion_criteria: Trauma patient with confirmed pregnancy
Estimated gestational age ≥ 18 weeks
exclusion_criteria: Non-pregnant patients
Pregnant patients < 18 weeks gestation
Non-trauma presentations

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Confirmation of pregnancy
Estimated gestational age (≥ 18 weeks)
Trauma activation status
Documentation indicating need for fetal heart monitoring
Documentation of obstetrical involvement or consultation
Trauma Surgeon assessment and disposition decision
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if gestational age is not documented | INDETERMINATE if need for fetal monitoring or obstetrical involvement cannot be determined | NOT TRIGGERED if patient is pregnant but does not meet any trigger criteria

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Immediate Call Center notification to page the OB ED physician when a trauma activation involves a pregnant patient ≥ 18 weeks gestation
If fetal heart monitoring is required:
– Direct call to OB ED physician at 812-842-4149
– If no response within 5 minutes, call 812-842-4309
OB ED physician responsibilities upon notification:
– Contact ED for clinical details
– Deploy Maternal and Neonatal Team (including Neonatal Transporter)
– Notify the patient’s Primary/Service OB Provider
Trauma Surgeon remains primary decision maker until care is formally relinquished
If no traumatic admission is required after Trauma Surgeon evaluation:
– Patient may be transferred to The Women’s Hospital (TWH) for obstetrical care
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

protocols.name: Autopsy in the Trauma Patient
inclusion_criteria: Trauma patient death occurring while admitted under the trauma service
exclusion_criteria: Non-trauma patient deaths
Trauma deaths clearly expected and attributable to documented injuries or comorbidities with no diagnostic uncertainty

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Time of death
Time interval from admission to death
CT imaging status prior to death
Operative intervention status prior to death
Trauma Surgeon determination regarding expected vs unexpected death
Vanderburgh County Coroner (VCC) disposition
Organ donor status
Family consent for autopsy when required
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if: | – Cause of death cannot be determined from available documentation, or | – Imaging or operative status prior to death cannot be confirmed, or | – Coroner disposition is not documented | NOT TRIGGERED if death is expected and clearly attributable to documented injuries or comorbid conditions

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Upon identification of an unexpected trauma death:
– Trauma Surgeon advises RN that autopsy is requested
RN must notify Vanderburgh County Coroner (VCC) per Hospital P&P 50-14S
If patient is a potential organ donor:
– RN notifies VCC to coordinate with Indiana Donor Network (IDN)
If VCC accepts the case:
– VCC directs autopsy process
If VCC declines the case:
– RN informs VCC that Trauma Surgeon has requested autopsy
– RN notifies Trauma Surgeon of VCC declination
– Trauma Surgeon places autopsy order (verbal order acceptable)
– Family consent obtained per P&P 50-14S
– RN notifies VCC to proceed
– Trauma Services PI RN and Pathology are notified
Autopsy performed by VCC
Body released to mortuary upon completion
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

protocols.name: Rehabilitative Services and Discharge Planning for the Trauma Patient
inclusion_criteria: Admitted trauma patient requiring inpatient care
Patient has injuries, precautions, functional limitations, or social factors that may impact mobility, self-care, cognition, or discharge planning
references: Rehabilitation assessment ideally within 48 hours of admission when indicated
Therapy consults placed once activity is approved
Social Work and Case Management engaged early for discharge planning

protocols.name: Trauma Surgeon Consult
inclusion_criteria: Injured patient with a traumatic mechanism
Patient does NOT meet Category I or Category II trauma activation criteria
Trauma Surgeon expertise is requested or provided via telephone consultation and/or in-person evaluation
references: EPIC consult order (IP Consult to Trauma Services)
ESA Call Center or answering service records

protocols.name: Resuscitation Role Assignments
inclusion_criteria: Activated trauma resuscitation in the Emergency Department
Applies to Category I and Category II trauma activations only

protocols.name: Special Consideration for the Management of the Pediatric Trauma Patient
inclusion_criteria: Trauma patient ≤ 14 years of age
Patient has sustained or is suspected to have sustained a traumatic injury

protocols.name: Non-Accidental Trauma (NAT) in the Pediatric Patient
inclusion_criteria: Pediatric trauma patient ≤ 14 years of age
Patient presents with suspected or possible non-accidental trauma (abuse or maltreatment)
exclusion_criteria: Patient > 14 years of age
Non-trauma presentations without concern for abuse or maltreatment

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Patient age
Injury history and identity of historian
Developmental age assessment
Complete head-to-toe physical examination
Imaging results (neuroimaging, skeletal survey, abdominal imaging as indicated)
Laboratory studies (CBC, CMP, coagulation studies, etc.)
Social Work consultation documentation
CPS and law enforcement notification documentation when indicated
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if history, examination, or imaging is incomplete | INDETERMINATE if Social Work or CPS involvement is not documented | NOT TRIGGERED if no suspicion indicators are identified after complete evaluation

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Immediate Social Work consultation upon suspicion of NAT
CPS and law enforcement notification per policy
Neuroimaging:
– Infants < 12 months: CT or MRI regardless of neurologic findings
– Children ≥ 12 months: CT if altered mental status or neurologic signs
Skeletal survey:
– All children < 3 years
– Follow-up survey at ~2 weeks when indicated
Ophthalmology evaluation obtained promptly when indicated
Medical photography performed as early as possible
Admission required for:
– Identified traumatic injury
– Ongoing NAT evaluation
– Safety concerns or CPS disagreement
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

protocols.name: Role of Trauma Services in the Admission or Consultation of Trauma Patients
inclusion_criteria: Injured patient presenting to Deaconess Midtown Hospital
Patient requires a determination regarding Trauma Services admission versus Trauma Surgeon consultation
exclusion_criteria: Non-trauma admissions
Medical patients without injury related to a traumatic mechanism

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Trauma activation level (Category I, Category II, or none)
Patient age
Pregnancy status when applicable
Determination of Trauma Services admission versus consultation
Admission service and Trauma Center admission type (when applicable)
Documentation of Trauma Surgeon notification
Documentation of Trauma Surgeon response time
Physician-to-physician communication documentation for direct admissions
Documentation of Trauma Services sign-off and transfer of care (when applicable)
acceptable_evidence: EPIC consult order (IP Consult to Trauma Services)
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if trauma activation level is not documented | INDETERMINATE if admission service or consultation timing is unclear | INDETERMINATE if Trauma Surgeon notification or response is not documented | NOT TRIGGERED if no traumatic injury is identified

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Category I and Category II activations:
– Trauma Services admission when inpatient admission is required
Trauma Surgeon consultation (non-activation):
– Phone call to ESA Call Center required
– EPIC consult order required
– ICU patient: Trauma Surgeon assessment within 1 hour of notification
– Non-ICU patient: Trauma Surgeon assessment within 6 hours of notification
Direct admissions:
– Injuries < 24 hours old should be admitted through the Emergency Department
– If bypassing the ED, the Admitting Physician must consult Trauma Services and speak directly with the Trauma Surgeon
Trauma Services sign-off:
– Trauma Surgeon must document transfer of care and identify receiving service
– Order placed if receiving service is not already involved
acceptable_evidence: EPIC consult order (IP Consult to Trauma Services)
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

references: EPIC consult order (IP Consult to Trauma Services)

protocols.name: Management of Transmediastinal Gunshot Wounds
inclusion_criteria: Trauma patient with penetrating gunshot wound
Trajectory suggests possible transmediastinal involvement (heart, great vessels, pulmonary hilar structures, tracheobronchial tree, or esophagus)
exclusion_criteria: Penetrating injuries without mediastinal trajectory
Non-gunshot penetrating mechanisms managed under other protocols

requirements.description: Required data elements present for evaluation and compliance determination.
trigger_conditions: Mechanism confirming gunshot wound
Entry and exit wound locations (if present)
Determination of suspected transmediastinal trajectory
Presence or absence of cardiac arrest
Presence or absence of witnessed signs of life
Hemodynamic status (SBP, heart rate)
Chest imaging results (portable chest x-ray; CT chest with contrast when stable)
Findings suggesting pneumothorax, hemothorax, mediastinal widening, pericardial effusion, or pulse differential
Documentation of esophageal imaging when non-operative management is pursued
acceptable_evidence: Imaging reports (chest x-ray, CT chest with contrast)
requirements.failure_consequence: INDETERMINATE if required data elements are missing.
requirements.notes: Failure behavior (protocol text): INDETERMINATE if trajectory cannot be determined | INDETERMINATE if witnessed signs-of-life status is unclear in cardiac arrest | INDETERMINATE if hemodynamic status is not documented | NOT TRIGGERED if gunshot wound does not suggest mediastinal traversal

requirements.description: Timing-critical elements met (first-pass placeholder; refine later).
trigger_conditions: Cardiac arrest with witnessed signs of life:
– Immediate emergent thoracotomy
– Consider right-sided thoracotomy for right-sided entry without exit; clamshell extension permitted
Hemodynamic instability:
– Immediate ATLS-directed resuscitation
– Large-bore IV access (one above and one below the diaphragm)
– Chest tube placement on side of entry wound
– Consider tension pneumothorax and pericardial tamponade
– Activate Massive Transfusion Protocol (MTP) and administer TXA as appropriate
Hemodynamically stable patients:
– Rapid diagnostic evaluation including chest x-ray
– CT chest with contrast when stable
– If mediastinal widening, supramediastinal enlargement, or radial pulse differential present → consider angiography
– Non-operatively managed patients require esophageal imaging (e.g., water-soluble swallow study)
All non-operatively managed patients:
– Admission required with follow-up imaging
acceptable_evidence: Imaging reports (chest x-ray, CT chest with contrast)
requirements.failure_consequence: NON_COMPLIANT if timing-critical elements not met when applicable.

references: Imaging reports (chest x-ray, CT chest with contrast)
